alert.note: Alert for Madison; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 9:01AM EDT until August 30 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Madison County in Big Bend Florida... North Central Taylor County in Big Bend Florida... * Until noon EDT. * At 901 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madison, Perry, Greenville, Moseley Hall, Shady Grove, Ebb, Sirmans, Hopewell, Lake Bird, Boyd, Iddo, Secotan, Eridu, Hamburg, Cherry Lake, Hanson, Perry-Foley Airport, Hampton Springs and Pinetta. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
